title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled in Super Bowl loss to Seahawks
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Christian Gonzalez and Craig Woodson excelled for the Patriots in a 29-13 Super Bowl LX loss to the Seahawks.
Drake Maye faced heavy pressure and struggled, with the Patriots' offensive line allowing six sacks during the game.
Seahawks' Kenneth Walker III was named Super Bowl MVP, exploiting Patriots' defense weaknesses for significant gains.

title: What an emotional Drake Maye said of Super Bowl LX loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye reflected on the Patriots' 29-13 Super Bowl LX loss to the Seattle Seahawks, citing missed opportunities.
Maye's turnovers were costly for New England, with Seattle scoring 17 points off two interceptions and a strip-sack.
Despite the loss, Maye expressed optimism for the Patriots' future, highlighting team growth and strong relationships.

title: Super Bowl 2026: Bad Bunny performs joyful, controversy-free halftime show
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Bad Bunny headlined the 2026 Super Bowl halftime show, featuring Lady Gaga and Ricky Martin as special guests.
The performance, held at Leviâ€™s Stadium, celebrated Latin culture and emphasized unity with a peaceful message.
The show, which included a real wedding on stage, faced criticism from President Trump calling it the worst ever.

title: Super Bowl celebrities: Here’s who was spotted in Santa Clara
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Celebrities Jay-Z, Blue Ivy, and Peyton Manning attended Super Bowl LX at Levi's Stadium, Santa Clara, on Feb. 8, 2026.
The Super Bowl game featured performances by Bad Bunny, Lady Gaga, and cameo by Cardi B and Karol G.
Stars including Justin Bieber, Hailey Bieber, Ricky Martin, and Adam Sandler were spotted at the event in Santa Clara.

title: Mass. State Police report fake account impersonating trooper
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Massachusetts State Police warn of a fake Instagram account impersonating a female trooper with over 100,000 followers.
The fake account, 'Sarita', uses AI content to depict a trooper and links to an adult OnlyFans page.
Similar impersonation found with a Santa Monica officer account with nearly 300,000 followers and shared images.

title: In Patriots territory, Seahawks fans find a home base for the Super Bowl
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Alma Cantina and White Bull Tavern in Boston hosted a Super Bowl party for Seattle Seahawks fans.
Over 100 reservations were made at Alma Cantina, attended by the Boston Seahawks Fan group members.
The Facebook group started 13 years ago, offering Seahawks fans in Boston a community to watch games.

title: Watch: Patriots’ Stefon Diggs shoved to the ground as punches fly during sideline scuffle
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots' Stefon Diggs was shoved by Seattle's Josh Jobe in a sideline scuffle during a game.
No penalties or ejections occurred despite Jobe appearing to throw punches at Diggs.
Diggs is facing assault charges from a December incident and has a court arraignment on Feb. 13.

title: Green Line service suspended between Park Street and Government Center after train derails
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A Green Line train derailed at Park Street station, halting service between Park Street and Government Center.
MBTA announced the derailment and service suspension at 2:46 p.m.; the train was rerailed by 6:43 p.m.
Repairs and inspections at Park Street continued Sunday night; riders advised to use the Orange Line.

title: ‘Good Will Dunkin’: Watch Ben Affleck, Tom Brady, Jennifer Aniston, and more in 2026 Super Bowl commercial
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Ben Affleck stars in Dunkin's 2026 Super Bowl ad, a parody titled 'Good Will Dunkin' featuring '90s sitcom stars.
The commercial aired before halftime of Super Bowl LX and included Tom Brady and Jennifer Aniston among others.
The ad humorously recreates a sitcom version of 'Good Will Hunting,' with Affleck's character working at Dunkin'.

title: Here’s Ann Michael Maye’s custom look for Super Bowl Sunday
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Ann Michael Maye, wife of Patriots QB Drake Maye, wore a custom Patriots jacket at Super Bowl 60.
The jacket was designed by Kristin Juszczyk and showcased on Instagram, paired with studded jeans and accessories.
Ann Michael Maye gained fame through social media baking videos and a partnership with NBC on a baking show.
